meanings.definition: To change something so much that it appears to be entirely new.
meanings.sent1: She reinvented her room by painting it a bright color.
meanings.sent2: The company reinvented its logo to attract younger customers.
meanings.sent3: He reinvented his hairstyle by using colorful hair clips.
meanings.sent4: The artist reinvented traditional music by adding modern beats.
meanings.sent5: The chef reinvented the classic dish with a unique twist.

meanings.definition: To bring back into existence or use.
meanings.sent1: After years of neglect, she reinvented the old bicycle and rode it again.
meanings.sent2: The museum reinvented an ancient artifact for a special exhibition.
meanings.sent3: He reinvented his childhood toy and made it a popular collectible.
meanings.sent4: The author reinvented a forgotten story and turned it into a bestseller.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reinvented an old theory, sparking new interest in the field.
